titles.title: Children's Sleepwear Labeling Act of 2011
A bill to require that labels on children's sleepwear that indicate the sleepwear is flame resistant to include the chemical name of the flame retardant used, and for other purposes.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

bill.summary: 12/16/2011--Introduced. Children's Sleepwear Labeling Act of 2011 - Directs the Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC) to require flame resistant children's sleepwear to include a label that indicates: (1) that it is flame resistant, and (2) the chemical name of the flame retardant used.
